body_content.explanation:
past simple and past participle of 
promote
to encourage people to like, buy, use, do, or support something:
examples: Advertising companies are always having to think up new ways to promote products.
The Institute is intended to promote an understanding of the politics and culture of the Arab world.
Greenpeace works to promote awareness of the dangers that threaten our planet today.
It has long been known that regular exercise promotes all-round good health.

body_content.explanation: to raise someone to a higher or more important position or rank:
examples: If I'm not promoted within the next two years, I'm going to change jobs.
She's just been promoted to senior sales rep.

body_content.explanation: to move a sports team to a higher group:
examples: If Coventry City win this match, they'll be promoted to the Premier League.

body_content.explanation: If a student is promoted, he or she goes up to the next level in school.
